I be a clinical psychologist and I really enjoy author gretchen ruin first book the happiness project I appreciate the organization address a different area each month as well as the foundation in research on happiness and wellbeing.i be hope that ruin next book well than before would be a sort of followup in some way it be this time with rubin more specifically address how to manage habit in order to be more happy and satisfied unfortunately I do not like this book nearly as much in fact I find it be a slog to get through the whole thing.my major problem with this book be something rubin address in she a note to the reader at the start of the book she say I see habit through the lens of my own experience so this account be color by my particular personality and interest and that be just iti.e . , ruin study of habit be almost wholly base on what have work for she and for people she know her prior book utilize overfrequent quote from her blog this one rely on anecdotal story from her family and friends.rubin attempt to make her theory adaptable to all by come up with a theory of what she call the four tendency or basically four different approach to habit she call these the upholder questioner obliger and rebel I do not find this model which rubin refer to throughout the book to be at all helpful whereas rubin may find herself solidly in the upholder category I personally be divide between upholder and questioner and I do not really respond to the suggestion for either.use this basic framework rubin go on to create many many more almost arbitrary category be you a lark or an owl again I inbetween . a mararthoner , sprinter or procrastinator underbuyer or overbuyer ? simplicity lover or abundance lover finisher or opener familiarity lover or novelty lover promotionfocuse or prevention focus small step or big step and all of that be only in the second chapter it feel very bogged down confusing and often irrelevant at least for me.rubin go on to address the importance of monitoring habit and to discuss the foundation for create habit there be some solid general tip in this section but eventually she fall back into create force category such as the series of loophole or exception to habit again there be some good idea here and there but they tend to get lose among the clutter.one of ruin chapter be call datum point of one this be probably the good way to view this bookthat be as one person experience with suggestion that may or may not relate personally give both that I do not see an overall general application to ruin theory and that I really do not enjoy this book overall I would not recommend it
